question: How do I open the Control Panel?
answer: From the Log In/Sign Up screen, tap the Evolt logo in the top left corner to open the Control Panel.

question: How do I connect the kiosk to Ethernet?
answer: Plug in the Ethernet cable and press Refresh on the Control Panel. Confirm Online status turns green and Network API shows connected.

question: How do I connect the kiosk to Wi-Fi?
answer: Insert the USB Wi-Fi dongle into USB port 1. In Control Panel select Network, turn Wi-Fi ON, tap New Connection, choose the network, enter the password, then return and press Refresh. Confirm Online status is green.

question: What do I do if New Connection is missing?
answer: Check that the Wi-Fi dongle is connected. In Control Panel go to System and ensure Lock USB is OFF, then refresh and power cycle. If still missing, test the dongle on another device and run a software update using Ethernet. Contact support if unresolved.

question: How do I run a software update?
answer: From Control Panel, confirm Online status is green, then press Software Update. The update runs automatically and takes about 3-4 minutes, then the kiosk reboots.

question: How do I log into the Operator Panel?
answer: Open the Operator Panel from Control Panel, then enter the kiosk-specific login found on the sticker on the back of the scanner. Save settings for Location, Kiosk Mode (Unattended), Printer, and Volume.

question: Where do I find the Operator Panel login?
answer: It is on the black sticker on the back of the scanner. If the sticker is missing, contact support.

question: What does the red Start Scanning button mean?
answer: It indicates the kiosk is ready for scanning after Operator Panel login. If the button is missing, log in again and ensure Scale API and Scale Status are Ready.

question: How do I set up a printer with a cable?
answer: Connect the printer via USB to the kiosk, then in Control Panel go to Printer, delete existing printers, add a printer, select the Brother HL-L2300D driver (brlaser v4), set default options, and set server default.

question: How do I connect a Brother printer over Wi-Fi?
answer: Connect the printer to Wi-Fi, then in Control Panel > Printers add a discovered network printer. Select the Brother HL-L2300D driver, set default options, and set server default.

question: How do I connect an HP M203W printer?
answer: In Control Panel > Printers, add the printer and select the HP Laserjet Pro M203-M206 Postscript driver, set default options, and set server default.

question: Which printers are compatible?
answer: Brother HL-L series models are compatible. HP M203W is also supported.

question: The kiosk is stuck on the Control Panel screen. What should I do?
answer: Ensure Online status is green, then open Operator Panel and log in using the sticker credentials. Set Kiosk Mode to Unattended and save. The Start Scanning button should appear.

question: The scanner is stuck on a white screen. How do I fix it?
answer: Restart the kiosk, reconnect to the internet, and run a software update. If the screen stays white, wait 10 minutes for recovery. Escalate to support if it does not recover.

question: Why does it say Offline?
answer: Check Network settings in Control Panel, verify Ethernet shows 100 connected or Wi-Fi is ON and connected, then press Refresh. Online status should be green.

question: Can the kiosk scan while offline?
answer: Yes, scanning can work offline, but results will not sync to Evolt Active or Insights until the kiosk reconnects to the internet.

question: No print button or preview after a scan. What do I do?
answer: Run a software update, then check Operator Panel print setting is Manual or Auto. Verify a default printer is set and re-pair if needed. Escalate if unresolved.

question: Prints are misaligned. How do I fix it?
answer: Prefer wired USB connection. If using wireless, delete and re-add the printer and select the correct model. Ensure printer and scanner are on the same network. Adjust print position if needed.

question: Printer keeps jamming. What should I do?
answer: Clear the jam, fan the paper before loading, and set paper type to Thick. If jams continue, adjust the paper type or contact Brother support.

question: Printer is in deep sleep. How do I disable it?
answer: On the printer: Menu > General Setup > Ecology > Sleep Time. Set to 50 minutes, then open Deep Sleep and set to OFF.

question: How do I calibrate the scanner?
answer: In Control Panel select Scale. Set Measurement Mode to Precision, Weight of Clothes to 0.5 kg (1.1 lbs), Scale Weight to 0.00, then press Calibrate and Save. Test with Weight Only measurement.

question: Weight readings are inaccurate. What should I check?
answer: Ensure scale settings are correct and calibrate. If the room has heavy electrical interference, switch Measurement Mode to Normal.

question: Nothing happens when I tap Log In/Sign Up. Why?
answer: If a faint grey circle appears, passcode is enabled. Tap the circle and enter the operator passcode to enable a scan, then try again. Re-enter Operator Panel credentials if needed.

question: How do I enable the passcode system?
answer: Email support to activate it. After activation, press Refresh on the Control Panel. A faint grey circle appears on the scan screen; enter the operator passcode each scan to enable it.

question: The scanner is not turning on. What should I do?
answer: Check the rear power switch, reseat the power cable (flat side up), and try a different outlet. Escalate if the unit shows lights or sound but does not boot.

question: What are daily housekeeping steps?
answer: Power on using the rear switch, ensure internet connectivity, log in to Operator Panel, and power off at end of day. Clean screen with microfiber cloth (apply Windex to cloth only) and clean handles and electrodes with low-moisture wipes.

question: What about minors and data privacy?
answer: Evolt complies with age-of-consent rules by jurisdiction. Underage data is anonymized in Insights. Minors can scan and see printed results, but identifiable data is not shown in Insights.

question: What should I do if scan did not complete?
answer: Restart the kiosk, confirm Online status is green, and re-run the scan. Prefer Ethernet if possible.

question: Why do I need to relog to the kiosk periodically?
answer: The kiosk occasionally requires security settings refresh for cloud connectivity. Log in again from the Control Panel to re-establish secure connection.

question: What if customer details cannot be found?
answer: Remove special characters from the mobile number and confirm it matches the number used for account creation. Ask the customer to update their details in the Evolt Active app if needed.

question: What is the recommended internet connection?
answer: Ethernet is preferred for stability. Wi-Fi requires strong signal and sufficient bandwidth; use Ethernet for remote maintenance when possible.

question: Where do I submit a support request?
answer: Use the support form at https://offers.evolt360.com/scanner-printer-support and include serial number and TeamViewer ID.

question: How do I fix a frozen screen or unresponsive buttons?
answer: Tap the Evolt logo and check for Operator password prompt, log out and back into Operator Panel, then power cycle if still unresponsive.

question: What should I do if the Start Scanning button is missing and Scale API is disconnected?
answer: Check internet connection and run a software update after reconnecting. If Scale API stays disconnected, contact support.

question: How do I resolve Wi-Fi working in the gym but kiosk cannot print or access Wi-Fi?
answer: Turn USB Lock OFF in Control Panel > System, restart, then ensure printer settings are not Off and set printer as server default.

question: What are the hardware variants?
answer: SOM has a fan, LP3 is the newest manufactured in 2025, and LP1 is the other variant (neither SOM nor LP3).

question: What serial numbers map to LP1 and LP3?
What should I do if the scanner is stuck on the Control Panel and will not start scans?
answer: Ensure Online status is green, then log into the Operator Panel using the back sticker credentials, set Kiosk Mode to Unattended, and save. Then press Start Scanning.

question: How do I verify the printer is set correctly?
answer: In the Control Panel, check the Default Printer section and ensure it shows the expected Brother HL-L or HP M203 driver.

question: What should I do if the scanner is stuck on a white screen after update?
answer: Restart, reconnect to the internet, and run the software update again. If still white, wait 10 minutes for recovery, then escalate.
